definition: to comb/fig. to sort out
a comb/to comb
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: I closed the window. I combed his long, black hair from his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 我关上窗，为他梳理了额头长长的黑发。

sentences.english: The guy in blue told me they were teasing the silk.
sentences.chinese: 穿蓝衣的这位老哥告诉我他们正梳理的是Silk。

sentences.english: The bird pecked finish, gently comb with rice sleek feathers.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿啄完稻谷，轻轻梳理着光润的羽毛。

sentences.english: The detaching distance is an important parameter for adjusting comber noil and combing quality.
sentences.chinese: 落棉隔距是影响精梳机落棉率与梳理质量的重要参数。

sentences.english: Last, the author discusses the relationship between judgment for conductingagain and judgment for performance.
sentences.chinese: 最后，本文对重作判决和履行判决的关系进行了梳理。

sentences.english: And smoothing an eyebrow with a dampened little finger used by males to denote effeminacy in other males.
sentences.chinese: 用潮湿的小指梳理眉毛，暗讽某男士有女人气。

sentences.english: Sorting out this story seems important for understanding the local landscape evolution.
sentences.chinese: 看起来梳理这个故事对理解当地景观演化很重要。

sentences.english: Use your hands, not a brush, so the teased hair stays lifted.
sentences.chinese: 用手把头发梳理好不要用头刷，头发就会依然服帖。

sentences.english: She combed it and then blow-dried it.
sentences.chinese: 她梳理好我的头发，把它们吹干。

sentences.english: Her hands were cold and shaky when she began to redden her lips and run a comb through her hair.
sentences.chinese: 当她开始涂口红和梳理头发时，她的双手冰冷发抖。

sentences.english: Spend time sorting out your dreams if you remember them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你还记得自己做过的梦，不妨花些时间进行梳理。

sentences.english: This chapter is a relatively complete and profound study of Dong's translation thought.
sentences.chinese: 本章比较全面和系统地梳理了董秋斯的翻译思想。

sentences.english: People always bring it food and drinks and comb its hair.
sentences.chinese: 人们给它好吃的好喝的，给他梳理鬃毛。

sentences.english: That dress matches her red hair.
sentences.chinese: 她正在梳理她那乱蓬蓬的头发。

sentences.english: The first chapter is to initiation tracing combing.
sentences.chinese: 第一章是对启蒙溯源的梳理。
梳棉过程中，单纤维梳理不好。

definition: to straighten out/to sort out/to organize
to sum up/to summarize/to conclude from facts/induction (method of deduction in logic)
to analyze/to dissect
to arrange/to tidy up/to sort out/to straighten out/to list systematically/to collate (data, files)/to pack (luggage)
to analyze/analysis/CL:個|个[ge4]
arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
one by one
to clarify (the facts)/clarification
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report/also written 匯總|汇总
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report
to spread out
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
clear/well-defined/limpid
to recall/to look back upon
to contrast/to compare/to place side by side for comparison (as parallel texts)/to check
analysis/research
lit. to spin silk from cocoons/fig. to make a painstaking investigation (idiom)
